snippet: The man was successfully treated in Liberia, and blood tests after he flew home were negative, but signs of the virus were found lingering in his semen.
abstract: Indian authorities hold 26-year-old man at quarantine facility as a cautionary measure after his semen tests positive for the Ebola virus; man had already been successfully treated for virus, which can linger in semen and other bodily fluids even after it is no longer detectable by blood tests.
lead_paragraph: The man was successfully treated in Liberia, and blood tests after he flew home were negative, but signs of the virus were found lingering in his semen.

headline.main: India Isolates Ebola Survivor at an Airport
headline.print_headline: India Isolates Ebola Survivor at an Airport
